summary: Fill empty soul gems without having to deal with soul trap and the like.
descriptionHtml:
**I no longer mod or play skyrim, mod is unsupported. Use or modify it as you wish and at your own risk**

Quick mod I scripted to allow you to fill empty soul gems from your inventory. Open your inventory, click the empty gem and it will replace it with a filled one.

update 1.1:
-added version that removes gold to charge soul gem. gold charge is 3 times the difference in value between the empty and filled gem.

I made this mod for me, because I play under a lot of specific role playing rules to make the game harder but not more tedious. Specifically, I only charge unique weapons (like dawnbreaker, or grimsever). When a self-enchanted or non-unique weapon runs out of charge I destroy it and switch to something else, so I can\'t just make a \"+12 sword of battles won\'t ever be hard again\" and be done with the game, I\'d have to go through the process of making a new one every time the charge ran out.  At the same time, I think soul trapping is tedious, so I made this to remove that part.

Known \"issues\":
-Does nothing with azura\'s star
-No idea what it might do on a quest specific soul gem, I wouldn\'t try it to be safe
-You still get the \"Item can\'t be equipped\" message
-I noticed a fraction of a second of lag after clicking a soul gem, noticible if you try to charge a lot of soul gems at once I guess

I\'m really not intending to support or do anything else with this. I might do small changes if it\'s something I can add easily, but no promises. This is not my ideal solution to making enchanting work like i want it to, but making a mod to make it work as I intend it to would take a while and I\'m working on other projects, so I just made this as a personal stopgap. Uploading in case anyone else might find it useful.
author: Griffinclaw
